front.title: Data Structure for Security Suitabilities of Cryptographic Algorithms (DSSC)

abstract.t: In many application areas it must be possible to prove the existence and integrity of digital signed data. This proof depends on the security suitability of the used cryptographic algorithms. Because algorithms can become weak over the years, it is necessary to periodically evaluate these security suitabilities. When signing or verifying data, these evaluations must be considered. This document specifies a data structure for security suitabilities of cryptographic algorithms which may be automatically interpreted.
